posts.post_content: Phage *does* kill you if you put it **onto the battlefield** with [Elvish Piper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elvish Piper)'s ability. Phage needs to be **cast**, as a spell, from your hand not to kill you. You will also lose if you cast her, as a spell, from anywhere except your hand (like with [Yawgmoth's Will](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Yawgmoth's Will)). I think they changed the terminology partly to lessen this kind of confusion between cast and put onto the battlefield.
posts.html:
Phage does kill you if you put it onto the battlefield with Elvish Piper's ability. Phage needs to be cast, as a spell, from your hand not to kill you. You will also lose if you cast her, as a spell, from anywhere except your hand (like with Yawgmoth's Will). I think they changed the terminology partly to lessen this kind of confusion between cast and put onto the battlefield.

posts.post_content: Phage is probably my favorite card ever. I used to run four of her in a straight black deck, toss a [whispersilk cloak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=whispersilk cloak) on and swing, but it's much more fun to discard it and prevent people from using[Lliliana Vess](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lliliana Vess)'s big ability, and holding onto a [Swerve](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swerve) for when they try to reach into your graveyard is always a great way to get a laugh.

Posted By: PolskiSuzeren (8/8/2009 10:49:51 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Easy way to make an opponent lose the game - [Flickerform](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Flickerform) could have been designed to beat this card...  
  
Or, as an alternative, try and do what I managed and O-Ring her, then destroy that O-Ring (or put another O-Ring on the first O-ring) to force Phage into play without being cast from a hand.  
  
There are ways round the deathtouch-type ability as well - first strike'll do nicely :) ([Toxic Iguanar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Toxic Iguanar) enchanted with [Asha's Favor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Asha's Favor) works fantastically well if they attack you with Phage and you flash in a [Qasali Ambusher](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Qasali Ambusher). A flying, first striking deathtouch-y little lizard is really rather fun)
posts.html:
Easy way to make an opponent lose the game - Flickerform could have been designed to beat this card...

Or, as an alternative, try and do what I managed and O-Ring her, then destroy that O-Ring (or put another O-Ring on the first O-ring) to force Phage into play without being cast from a hand.

There are ways round the deathtouch-type ability as well - first strike'll do nicely :) (Toxic Iguanar enchanted with Asha's Favor works fantastically well if they attack you with Phage and you flash in a Qasali Ambusher. A flying, first striking deathtouch-y little lizard is really rather fun)

posts.post_content:
Nice ability and flavour, powerwise though it's just "meh". It's a 4/4 for seven mana with deathtouch. Your opponent should by that time have enough mana to counter it, kill it, or block it all day long. If you have bad luck, your opponent has a [flicker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=flicker) effect which means you just killed yourself by playing phage.  
  
Nice idea and everything, but just too costy.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Whilst the card does say play, the gatherer information has been updated to \*cast\*, meaning you have to pay the mana cost and put it onto the battlefield from your hand.  
  
Whilst lots of 'instant win' cards have potential, realistically, the lack of shroud on most of them makes them sitting ducks, or they have such unrealistic expectations that you're likely to never pull them off (I've only ever 'instant won' twice myself - both casual times - the first in a multiplayer match where two Soul Wardens and everyone's creatures coming out gave me enough health for Felidar Sovereign to win it for me, and another where I was playing a Bant lifegaining deck (splashed with a little red), and Mayael's Aria + Cradle of Vitality + Wall of Reverence ended up comboing for the win (thanks to the opponent having pretty much no spot removal).  
  
In terms of Phage, being black protects her from Terror/Doom Blade, and her toughness helps protect her from bolts, but she can still be removed. Protection from... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Whilst the card does say play, the gatherer information has been updated to *cast*, meaning you have to pay the mana cost and put it onto the battlefield from your hand.

Whilst lots of 'instant win' cards have potential, realistically, the lack of shroud on most of them makes them sitting ducks, or they have such unrealistic expectations that you're likely to never pull them off (I've only ever 'instant won' twice myself - both casual times - the first in a multiplayer match where two Soul Wardens and everyone's creatures coming out gave me enough health for Felidar Sovereign to win it for me, and another where I was playing a Bant lifegaining deck (splashed with a little red), and Mayael's Aria + Cradle of Vitality + Wall of Reverence ended up comboing for the win (thanks to the opponent having pretty much no spot removal).

In terms of Phage, being black protects her from Terror/Doom Blade, and her toughness helps protect her from bolts, but she can still be removed. Protection from... (see all)
